segment.source: Microsoft Passport errors during PIN creation (Windows 10)
segment.target: Microsoft Passport errors during PIN creation (Windows 10)

segment.source: When you set up Microsoft Passport in Windows 10, you may get an error during the Create a work PIN step.
segment.target: When you set up Microsoft Passport in Windows 10, you may get an error during the Create a work PIN step.

segment.source: Microsoft Passport errors during PIN creation
segment.target: Microsoft Passport errors during PIN creation

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 10 Mobile
segment.target: Windows 10 Mobile

segment.source: When you set up Microsoft Passport in Windows 10, you may get an error during the Create a work PIN step.
segment.target: When you set up Microsoft Passport in Windows 10, you may get an error during the Create a work PIN step.

segment.source: This topic lists some of the error codes with recommendations for mitigating the problem.
segment.target: This topic lists some of the error codes with recommendations for mitigating the problem.

segment.source: If you get an error code that is not listed here, contact Microsoft Support.
segment.target: If you get an error code that is not listed here, contact Microsoft Support.

segment.source: Where is the error code?
segment.target: Where is the error code?

segment.source: The following image shows an example of an error during Create a work PIN.
segment.target: The following image shows an example of an error during Create a work PIN.

segment.source: Error mitigations
segment.target: Error mitigations

segment.source: When a user encounters an error when creating the work PIN, advise the user to try the following steps.
segment.target: When a user encounters an error when creating the work PIN, advise the user to try the following steps.

segment.source: Many errors can be mitigated by one of these steps.
segment.target: Many errors can be mitigated by one of these steps.

segment.source: Try to create the PIN again.
segment.target: Try to create the PIN again.

segment.source: Some errors are transient and resolve themselves.
segment.target: Some errors are transient and resolve themselves.

segment.source: Sign out, sign in, and try to create the PIN again.
segment.target: Sign out, sign in, and try to create the PIN again.

segment.source: Reboot the device and then try to create the PIN again.
segment.target: Reboot the device and then try to create the PIN again.

segment.source: Unjoin the device from Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), rejoin, and then try to create the PIN again.
segment.target: Unjoin the device from Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), rejoin, and then try to create the PIN again.

segment.source: To unjoin a desktop PC, go to SettingsSystemAbout and select Disconnect from organization.
segment.target: To unjoin a desktop PC, go to SettingsSystemAbout and select Disconnect from organization.

segment.source: To unjoin a device running Windows 10 Mobile, you must reset the device.
segment.target: To unjoin a device running Windows 10 Mobile, you must reset the device.

segment.source: On mobile devices, if you are unable to setup a PIN after multiple attempts, reset your device and start over.
segment.target: On mobile devices, if you are unable to setup a PIN after multiple attempts, reset your device and start over.

segment.source: For help on how to reset your phone go to Reset my phone.
segment.target: For help on how to reset your phone go to Reset my phone.

segment.source: If the error occurs again, check the error code against the following table to see if there is another mitigation for that error.
segment.target: If the error occurs again, check the error code against the following table to see if there is another mitigation for that error.

segment.source: When no mitigation is listed in the table, contact Microsoft Support for assistance.
segment.target: When no mitigation is listed in the table, contact Microsoft Support for assistance.

segment.source: Hex
segment.target: Hex

segment.source: Cause
segment.target: Cause

segment.source: Mitigation
segment.target: Mitigation

segment.source: Authorization token does not contain device ID
segment.target: Authorization token does not contain device ID

segment.source: Unjoin the device from Azure AD and rejoin
segment.target: Unjoin the device from Azure AD and rejoin

segment.source: User cancelled an interactive dialog
segment.target: User cancelled an interactive dialog

segment.source: User will be asked to try again
segment.target: User will be asked to try again

segment.source: The container or key was not found
segment.target: The container or key was not found

segment.source: Unjoin the device from Azure AD and rejoin
segment.target: Unjoin the device from Azure AD and rejoin

segment.source: The container or key already exists
segment.target: The container or key already exists

segment.source: Unjoin the device from Azure AD and rejoin
segment.target: Unjoin the device from Azure AD and rejoin

segment.source: NTE_NO_MEMORY
segment.target: NTE_NO_MEMORY

segment.source: Close programs which are taking up memory and try again.
segment.target: Close programs which are taking up memory and try again.

segment.source: NTE_BAD_DATA
segment.target: NTE_BAD_DATA

segment.source: Unjoin the device from Azure AD and rejoin
segment.target: Unjoin the device from Azure AD and rejoin

segment.source: TPM is not set up.
segment.target: TPM is not set up.

segment.source: Sign on with an administrator account.
segment.target: Sign on with an administrator account.

segment.source: Click Start, type "tpm.msc", and select tpm.msc Microsoft Common Console Document.
segment.target: Click Start, type "tpm.msc", and select tpm.msc Microsoft Common Console Document.

segment.source: In the Actions pane, select Prepare the TPM.
segment.target: In the Actions pane, select Prepare the TPM.

segment.source: NTE_AUTHENTICATION_IGNORED
segment.target: NTE_AUTHENTICATION_IGNORED

segment.source: Reboot the device.
segment.target: Reboot the device.

segment.source: If the error occurs again after rebooting, reset the TPM or run Clear-TPM
segment.target: If the error occurs again after rebooting, reset the TPM or run Clear-TPM

segment.source: Policy requires TPM and the device does not have TPM.
segment.target: Policy requires TPM and the device does not have TPM.

segment.source: Change the Passport policy to not require a TPM.
segment.target: Change the Passport policy to not require a TPM.

segment.source: User is not authorized to enroll
segment.target: User is not authorized to enroll

segment.source: Check if the user has permission to perform the operation​.
segment.target: Check if the user has permission to perform the operation​.

segment.source: Registration quota reached
segment.target: Registration quota reached

segment.source: Unjoin some other device that is currently joined using the same account or increase the maximum number of devices per user.
segment.target: Unjoin some other device that is currently joined using the same account or increase the maximum number of devices per user.

segment.source: Operation successful but the device requires a reboot
segment.target: Operation successful but the device requires a reboot

segment.source: Reboot the device.
segment.target: Reboot the device.

segment.source: The AIK certificate is not valid or trusted
segment.target: The AIK certificate is not valid or trusted

segment.source: Sign out and then sign in again.
segment.target: Sign out and then sign in again.

segment.source: The attestation statement of the transport key is invalid
segment.target: The attestation statement of the transport key is invalid

segment.source: Sign out and then sign in again.
segment.target: Sign out and then sign in again.

segment.source: Discovery request is not in a valid format
segment.target: Discovery request is not in a valid format

segment.source: Sign out and then sign in again.
segment.target: Sign out and then sign in again.

segment.source: The device is required to be joined to an Active Directory domain
segment.target: The device is required to be joined to an Active Directory domain

segment.source: ​Join the device to an Active Directory domain.
segment.target: ​Join the device to an Active Directory domain.

segment.source: The federation provider configuration is empty
segment.target: The federation provider configuration is empty

segment.source: Go to http://clientconfig.microsoftonline-p.net/FPURL.xml and verify that the file is not empty.
segment.target: Go to http://clientconfig.microsoftonline-p.net/FPURL.xml and verify that the file is not empty.

segment.source: ​The federation provider domain is empty
segment.target: ​The federation provider domain is empty

segment.source: Go to http://clientconfig.microsoftonline-p.net/FPURL.xml and verify that the FPDOMAINNAME element is not empty.
segment.target: Go to http://clientconfig.microsoftonline-p.net/FPURL.xml and verify that the FPDOMAINNAME element is not empty.

segment.source: The federation provider client configuration URL is empty
segment.target: The federation provider client configuration URL is empty

segment.source: Go to http://clientconfig.microsoftonline-p.net/FPURL.xml and verify that the CLIENTCONFIG element contains a valid URL.
segment.target: Go to http://clientconfig.microsoftonline-p.net/FPURL.xml and verify that the CLIENTCONFIG element contains a valid URL.
